required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Treatment Response Prediction System of mCRC Patients Based on CTC
clinical_study.official_title: Treatment Response Prediction System of Metastatic Colorectal Cancer Based on Circulating Tumor Cells

brief_summary.textblock: This study enrolling patients with metastatic colorectal cancer. Detecting CTC at different points in the treatment process. Descripting the molecular atlas of CTC in mCRC patients. Building and validating a response prediction system of mCTC patients.

primary_outcome.description: The sensitivity of the response prediction model
The specificity of the response prediction model

arm_group.description: The training cohort that used to built the response prediction model
The validation cohort that used to validate the response prediction model

intervention.description: Detecting CTC in different time points of treatment (like PR, PD, pre and post-operation)

study_pop.textblock: Patients with metastatic colorectal cancer (with lung or liver metastases) who receiving chemotherapy with or without target therapy

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age 18-80 years;
histologically proven colorectal liver metastasis
With liver-dominant disease (extrahepatic metastases limited to lung metastases)
ECOG 0-1
A life expectancy of ≥ 3 months
Adequate hematologic function: absolute neutrophil count (ANC)≥1.5×109/l, platelets≥75×109/l, and international normalized ratio (INR) ≤1.3
Adequate liver and renal function: total bilirubin ≤2.0 mg/dl, alanine aminotransferase, aspartate aminotransferase ≤ 5x upper limit of normal, and albumin≥2.5 g/dl, serum creatinine≤2.0 mg/dl
Written informed consent for participation in the trial.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Other previous malignancy within 5 years
Have metastases other than liver and lung metastases
Receiving any treatment before first blood collection
